source/include/boost/detail/lightweight_mutex.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_DETAIL_LIGHTWEIGHT_MUTEX_HPP_INCLUDED
00002 #define BOOST_DETAIL_LIGHTWEIGHT_MUTEX_HPP_INCLUDED
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 
00006 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00007 # pragma once
00008 #endif
00009 
00010 //
00011 //  boost/detail/lightweight_mutex.hpp - lightweight mutex
00012 //
00013 //  Copyright (c) 2002, 2003 Peter Dimov and Multi Media Ltd.
00014 //
00015 //  Permission to copy, use, modify, sell and distribute this software
00016 //  is granted provided this copyright notice appears in all copies.
00017 //  This software is provided "as is" without express or implied
00018 //  warranty, and with no claim as to its suitability for any purpose.
00019 //
00020 //  typedef <unspecified> boost::detail::lightweight_mutex;
00021 //
00022 //  boost::detail::lightweight_mutex meets a subset of the Mutex concept
00023 //  requirements: http://www.boost.org/libs/thread/doc/mutex_concept.html#Mutex
00024 //
00025 //  * Used by the smart pointer library
00026 //  * Performance oriented
00027 //  * Header-only implementation
00028 //  * Small memory footprint
00029 //  * Not a general purpose mutex, use boost::mutex, CRITICAL_SECTION or
00030 //    pthread_mutex instead.
00031 //  * Never spin in a tight lock/do-something/unlock loop, since
00032 //    lightweight_mutex does not guarantee fairness.
00033 //  * Never keep a lightweight_mutex locked for long periods.
00034 //
00035 //  The current implementation can use a pthread_mutex, a CRITICAL_SECTION,
00036 //  or a platform-specific spinlock.
00037 //
00038 //  You can force a particular implementation by defining BOOST_LWM_USE_PTHREADS,
00039 //  BOOST_LWM_USE_CRITICAL_SECTION, or BOOST_LWM_USE_SPINLOCK.
00040 //
00041 //  If neither macro has been defined, the default is to use a spinlock on Win32,
00042 //  and a pthread_mutex otherwise.
00043 //
00044 //  Note that a spinlock is not a general synchronization primitive. In particular,
00045 //  it is not guaranteed to be a memory barrier, and it is possible to "livelock"
00046 //  if a lower-priority thread has acquired the spinlock but a higher-priority
00047 //  thread is spinning trying to acquire the same lock.
00048 //
00049 //  For these reasons, spinlocks have been disabled by default except on Windows,
00050 //  where a spinlock can be several orders of magnitude faster than a CRITICAL_SECTION.
00051 
00052 
00053 //  Note: lwm_linux.hpp has been disabled by default; see the comments
00054 //        inside for more info.
00055 
00056 
00057 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00058 
00059 //  Note to implementors: if you write a platform-specific spinlock
00060 //  for a platform that supports pthreads, be sure to test its performance
00061 //  against the pthreads-based version using shared_ptr_timing_test.cpp and
00062 //  shared_ptr_mt_test.cpp. Custom versions are usually not worth the trouble
00063 //  _unless_ the performance gains are substantial.
00064 //
00065 //  Be sure to compare against a "real" pthreads library;
00066 //  shared_ptr_timing_test.cpp will compile succesfully with a stub do-nothing
00067 //  pthreads library, since it doesn't create any threads.
00068 
00069 #if (defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__)) && !defined(BOOST_LWM_USE_CRITICAL_SECTION) && !defined(BOOST_LWM_USE_PTHREADS)
00070 # define BOOST_LWM_WIN32
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 #if !defined(BOOST_HAS_THREADS)
00074 #  if defined(BOOST_LWM_WIN32)
00075 #    include <boost/detail/lwm_win32_nt.hpp>
00076 #  else
00077 #    include <boost/detail/lwm_nop.hpp>
00078 #  endif
00079 #elif defined(BOOST_LWM_USE_SPINLOCK) && defined(BOOST_USE_ASM_ATOMIC_H)
00080 #  include <boost/detail/lwm_linux.hpp>
00081 #elif defined(BOOST_LWM_USE_CRITICAL_SECTION)
00082 #  include <boost/detail/lwm_win32_cs.hpp>
00083 #elif defined(BOOST_LWM_USE_PTHREADS)
00084 #  include <boost/detail/lwm_pthreads.hpp>
00085 #elif defined(BOOST_LWM_WIN32)
00086 #  include <boost/detail/lwm_win32.hpp>
00087 #elif defined(BOOST_LWM_USE_SPINLOCK) && defined(__sgi)
00088 #  include <boost/detail/lwm_irix.hpp>
00089 #elif defined(BOOST_LWM_USE_SPINLOCK) && defined(__GLIBCPP__)
00090 #  include <boost/detail/lwm_gcc.hpp>
00091 #elif defined(BOOST_HAS_PTHREADS)
00092 #  define BOOST_LWM_USE_PTHREADS
00093 #  include <boost/detail/lwm_pthreads.hpp>
00094 #else
00095 // Use #define BOOST_DISABLE_THREADS to avoid the error
00096 #  error Unrecognized threading platform
00097 #endif
00098 
00099 #endif // #ifndef BOOST_DETAIL_LIGHTWEIGHT_MUTEX_HPP_INCLUDED
